Pleased to welcome @mremae, @UNBiodiversity Executive Secretary, at @WHO. We had a very good discussion on how to strengthen our collaboration on pandemic preparedness, as global preparedness has roots in our ecosystem and a 'One health‚Äô approach is key. https://t.co/QMH1PEPOZb

To end the #COVID19 pandemic, as much as we need #VaccinEquity, we also need equitable access to tests & treatments. That's why @WHO has strongly supported üáÆüá≥ & üáøüá¶'s call for an intellectual property waiver. It would save millions of lives & livelihoods. https://t.co/mNoHR52H9U

This year, #WorldTBDay puts the spotlight on the urgent need to invest in the fight to #EndTB. This is especially critical in the context of #COVID19 pandemic, which has caused disruptions that have led @WHO to report an increase in TB deaths for the first time in over a decade https://t.co/CRpyCKA3B0

The #COVID19 pandemic is not over. Until we reach high vaccination coverage in all countries, we'll continue to face the risk of infections surging & new variants emerging that evade vaccines. @WHO‚Äôs target remains to vaccinate 70% of the population of every country by mid-2022. https://t.co/wmbOcUpiRL
